item.title: Arc Raiders Players Collected Lots And Lots Of Rubber Ducks In The Server Slam
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Embark Studios recently wrapped up a big Server Slam test for Arc Raiders ahead of its public launch on October 30, and the test was huge. Given that, Embark got a lot of feedback, and the developer has now disclosed some of what's it's working on addressing ahead of release.

The developer said player feedback, along with the team's own internal data, provided "crucial insights" into how Arc Raiders can be improved for launch. Here are the key points, as written by the developer.

  • Stability: You helped us quickly identify and resolve stability issues across all platforms during the test. We’ve locked in even more solutions leading up to launch day to ensure a smooth launch experience.
  • The Flying ARCs: It turns out their awareness was a bit too high, allowing them to essentially see through trees and bushes. This made their vision unintentionally over-powered, but we’ve adjusted what they can see now, so expect a fairer fight at launch.
  • The Dam Tower: We watched many of you bravely, and perhaps a little too easily, access the Dam Control Tower on Dam Battlegrounds. It was fun to watch, but a bit too accessible for a key loot location. That's been fixed to keep the challenge sharp.
  • Visual Difference: Some noticed a visual difference between Server Slam and earlier tests on certain hardware. The default settings did change a bit to favor more performance, and we are looking into tuning further to strike the right balance.

Additionally, Embark said feedback from the test gave the studio valuable feedback in terms of bug-fixes and game balance. "Every piece of data and feedback you provided is helping us to make Arc Raiders a better game," the developer said.

The studio also shared some key milestones from the test that players collectively achieved, including 30 million rounds played, 58 million Arc destroyed, and, most importantly, that players collected more than 800,000 rubber ducks.

Arc Raiders launches on October 30 for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC, and it's priced at $40 USD. Ahead of launch, you can check out GameSpot's top 15 tips to know before launch.

item.title: CoD: Black Ops 7 Dev Reveals Season 1 Content - New Maps And Holiday Events Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 doesn't release until November 14, but Treyarch is already breaking down the content players can expect in the first season. The developer's latest Dev Talk video confirmed seven new multiplayer maps, three zombies maps, new weapons, seasonal events, and more for Season 1 of Black Ops 7.

This new Black Ops 7 Dev Talk video boasts that Season 1 is packed with content across multiplayer and Zombies. "This will be the biggest season we've ever done in franchise history," said senior director of production Yale Miller.

There are seven 6v6 maps confirmed for multiplayer, and this will be a mix of new and remastered maps. The video shows a brief look at Fate, which is a brand-new map inspired by the game's campaign mission called Time and Fate. This features a trippy setting of fractured and floating building pieces from a city in Nicaragua. Other maps briefly shown are Odysseus, which is based on the campaign mission of the same name, and Utopia is a futuristic Guild facility based in Australia. For the season's remasters, Meltdown from Black Ops 2 will return in Season 1 of Black Ops 7.

The developer also confirmed map changes were being made based on community feedback from the beta. Treyarch associate design director Matt Scronce said that the team is looking at all the doors across Black Ops 7's entire map pool to see where it can reduce automatic doors without disrupting gameplay.

Seven weapons are coming in Season 1. Scronce confirms the fan-favorite Maddox assault rifle from Black Ops 4 is included in the lineup. A crossbow and the ballistic knife are also returning.

As for game modes, the return of Treyarch's crossbow and ballistic knife also means the popular Sticks and Stones party mode is packed into the Season 1 update. Prop Hunt and seasonal limited-time modes are confirmed as well.

For Zombies, there will be three maps. Season 1 is confirmed to have one brand-new round-based map and two survival maps based on locations from the Ashes of the Damned launch map. The update will add more augments, field upgrades, ammo mods, and other Zombies content. Players can also expect two limited-time holiday modes for Zombies on the season's new round-based map.

Additionally, the Black Ops 7 variant of Nuketown arrives on November 20, so players won't need to wait long after launch to start receiving more content.

Treyarch's previous Dev Talk video discussed multiplayer changes players can expect at launch, including adjustments to the game's movement, aim assist, and perks.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 launches on November 14 for PlayStation 4 and 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and PC.

item.title: First Paranormal Activity: Threshold Gameplay Trailer Is Full Of Found-Footage Scares
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

During today's DreadXP livestream, a spooky new look at the Paranormal Activity video game was revealed. The gameplay teaser for Paranormal Activity: Threshold showed off a taste of what players can expect, as they find themselves stuck inside a haunted house full of hostile entities and puzzles.

The trailer teased an approach similar to the film franchise, as it was full of found-footage shots and a foreboding sense of dread that the film franchise is known for.

DarkStone Digital--the team behind 2022's The Mortuary Assistant--is working on the game, and it'll feature a Haunt System designed to dynamically alter the types and intensity of scares that players will encounter during their sessions.

Publisher DreadXP stated that game director Brian Clarke aims to replicate his signature approach to fear and immersion in the Paranormal Activity game, while also expanding on the franchise's infamous found-footage style horror in "new and nightmarish" ways.

While it doesn't have a release date yet, DreadXP says it will reveal more about Paranormal Activity: Threshold's platforms and launch timing in the months to come. Fans of the film franchise looking for some effective shock treatment can grab a new Blu-ray set of the original movies.

The $50 Blu-ray box set includes all eight movies, starting from the original low-budget thriller up through Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2's Final DLC Launches This November
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Warhorse Studios has one more DLC coming for its action-RPG Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, which we've known since January 2025. Now, though, the Czech developer has not only dropped a new trailer for Mysteria Ecclesia, but also revealed that this last story expansion will launch on November 11 for consoles and PC.

Mysteria Ecclesia sees protagonist Henry of Skalitz (played by The Suspect's Tom McKay) become something of a private investigator as he explores the Sedletz Monastery to follow the clues and search for answers about the spread of a deadly disease. You can check out the brief trailer for the DLC just below.

One of the best RPGs of the year, the game received a superb 9/10 in our Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 review. Critic Richard Wakeling called it a "triumphant sequel," saying, "This is a massively improved sequel in every other area, with better combat, quest design, and none of the technical issues that plagued the original."

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is available now for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. You can get Mysteria Ecclesia and the two other add-ons, Brushes with Death and Legacy of the Forge, through the game's $30 Expansion Pass or $90 Gold Edition.

item.title: Fortnite Will Add Moe From The Simpsons In Next Major Update, It Seems
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Epic Games has yet to officially confirm that the next major Fortnite update will focus on The Simpsons, but the evidence continues to grow. Today, it was reported that Moe Szyslak, the slimy bartended from Moe's Tavern, will have a skin in the forthcoming Simpsons collaboration.

He would join Ned Flanders, who was previously leaked, along with presumably some or all of the main Simpson family members like Homer and Marge.

Moe is one of the best-known and most-recognizable characters from The Simpsons, so him being included with the rumored collab is not a big surprise. The leak, from user Blortzen, said Moe will have a skin in Fortnite and will appear on the map as an NPC. Moe's Tavern will be on the map, too, it seems.

The rumored upcoming Fortnite collaboration with The Simpsons is said to be significant, with Fortnite adding a new map based on Springfield and featuring its various points of interest, like the nuclear power plant where Homer works.

For more, be sure to check out GameSpot's rundown of everything we've heard so far about the rumored Simpsons collaboration with Fortnite. The new season is rumored to begin in early November.

In semi-related news, a fan-made re-skin of The Simpsons Hit & Run focusing on Futurama has drawn the praise of one of the game's original designers.

As for the TV series, The Simpsons debuted in 1989 and is now in its 37th season. The show was renewed earlier this year and will continue through at least Season 40 in 2028-2029. A second Simpsons Movie is coming as well, and it's set for release in July 2027, on the same day as A Minecraft Movie 2.
